title: How have coffee shops changed in your country over the years?

korean: 한국의 카페 문화는 정말 많이 변한 것 같아.
예전엔 프랜차이즈 카페가 대부분이었는데, 요즘엔 개인 카페가 엄청 많아.
각자 콘셉트가 다 달라서 선택의 폭이 넓어졌어.
인테리어에도 정말 신경 쓰는 카페들이 많아졌어.
사진 찍기 좋은 예쁜 카페들이 계속 생기고 있어.
메뉴도 다양해져서 단순히 커피만 파는 게 아니라 디저트나 브런치도 많이 팔아.
건강을 생각한 메뉴들도 많이 나오고 있어.
배달 앱을 통해 커피를 주문하는 것도 일반화됐고.
친환경적인 요소도 중요해져서 텀블러 사용하면 할인해 주는 곳도 많아.
북카페나 애견 카페 같은 특색 있는 카페들도 많이 생겼어.
전체적으로 카페가 단순히 커피 마시는 곳이 아니라 문화 공간이 된 것 같아.
english: I think café culture in Korea has, like, really changed a lot.
In the past, most were franchise cafés, but these days there are tons of independent cafés.
Each has a different concept, so the range of choices has widened.
Many cafés have started paying real attention to interior design.
Pretty cafés that are good for taking pictures keep appearing.
The menus have also become diverse, so they don't just sell coffee but also sell lots of desserts and brunch.
Many menus considering health are also, you know, coming out.
Ordering coffee through delivery apps has also become common.
Many cafés where you order through kiosks have also increased.
Eco-friendly elements have become important too, so many places give discounts if you use a tumbler.
Distinctive cafés like book cafés or dog cafés have also, like, appeared a lot.
Overall, it seems cafés have become not just places to drink coffee but cultural spaces.
